pmplots
  • Reference

Save plot objects as .pdf file after labeling with Source graphic and Source code labels.

Save plot objects as .pdf file after labeling with Source graphic and Source code labels.

mrggsave(x, script, stem = "Rplot", dir = "../deliv/figure",
  prefix = gsub("^\\.\\./", "./", dir), onefile = TRUE,
  arrange = FALSE, labsep = "\n", fontsize = 7, textGrob.x = 0.01,
  textGrob.y = 1, margin = c(0.1, 0.1, 0.7, 0.1), unit = "cm",
  draw = FALSE, nosave = FALSE, ...)

mrggdraw(...)

Arguments

x

an object or list of objects of class gg
script

the name of the script generating the gg objects
stem

to form the name of the output .pdf file
dir

output directory for .pdf file
prefix

gets prepended to the output file path in the Source graphic label
onefile

passed to pdf
arrange

logical; if TRUE, arrange the ggplot objects on a single page with arrangeGrob
labsep

character separator (or newline) for Source code and Source graphic labels
fontsize

for Source graphic and Source code labels
textGrob.x

passed to textGrob (as x)
textGrob.y

passed to textGrob (as y)
margin

numeric vector of length 4 or 1 to set top, right, bottom, left margin
unit

unit to go along with margin sizes
draw

if TRUE, the image is printed but not saved
nosave

logical; if TRUE, return the labeled objects
...

other arguments passed to pdf or arrangeGrob

Details

  • This function will require the gridExtra package

Examples


data(Theoph)
require(ggplot2)

Script <- "example.R"

## NOTE: see default value for dir argument, which should be appropriate for project work
## Changing it here only for the example
dir <- "."


p1 <- ggplot(data=Theoph) + geom_line(aes(x=Time, y=conc, group=Subject))
p2 <- ggplot(data=Theoph) + geom_line(aes(x=Time, y=conc)) + facet_wrap(~Subject)

mrggsave(p1, Script, "plot1", dir=dir)
mrggsave(p2, Script, "plot2", dir=dir)

mrggsave(list(p1,p2), Script, "both_plots", dir=dir)
mrggsave(list(p1,p2), Script, "separate_files", onefile=FALSE, dir=dir)

mrggsave(p1, Script, "different_shape", width=10, height=4, dir=dir)

mrggsave(list(p1,p2), Script, "onepage", dir=dir, arrange=TRUE, nrow=1, ncol=2)
